definition: to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong

sentences.english: As he, in his swooning ears, the choir's amen.
sentences.chinese: 神魂顛倒的耳中，只想聽到唱詩班的歌。

sentences.english: You got it all upside down, " shouted Matt at Thorne."
sentences.chinese: “你完全搞顛倒啦，”麥特向桑恩嚷起來。

sentences.english: He lost his head over that woman.
sentences.chinese: 他叫那個女人給弄得神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: We use it to describe someone who confuses right and wrong deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 我們用它來形容那些故意顛倒是非的人。

sentences.english: Have nothing in your heart, for you will also become topsy-turvy.
sentences.chinese: 沒有在你的心裏，你也將成爲顛倒。

sentences.english: In a word, Sophia was in love with him to distraction.
sentences.chinese: 簡單一句話，蘇菲亞愛他愛得神魂顛倒了。

sentences.english: But the merry men preferred to call him Little John .
sentences.chinese: 但羅賓漢一夥把他的姓和名顛倒過來，改成了小約翰。

sentences.english: Why not turn it upside down?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不把它上下顛倒呢？

sentences.english: Actually I am spaced-out all day.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我一天都神魂顛倒的。

sentences.english: An upside-down one reveals a different world.
sentences.chinese: 而上下顛倒的地圖則展示了一個不同的世界。

sentences.english: Relation between them is principal and subordinate, which cannot be reversed.
sentences.chinese: 兩者之間是主從的關係，不能互相顛倒。

sentences.english: Her wit, her voice my heart beguiles.
sentences.chinese: 她的幽默風趣，她的悅耳聲音，讓我神魂顛倒。

sentences.english: Before him, of course, others had turned her head.
sentences.chinese: 在他之前，她當然爲別人神魂顛倒過。

sentences.english: It'll drive you crazy at first.
sentences.chinese: 一開始會叫你神魂顛倒的。

definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
